notesStmt.note: Folios 1-4 are a later addition. Ye᾿udah ha-Kohen Yeḥonatan, dated [5]482 (1722): inscribed in an owner's entry, as well as in an entry of sale to Shabtai ben Molkho, dated [5]494 (1734), folio 1v.A pencil entry beginning 'Avraham Zanun', folio 1r.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A festival prayer book for Rosh ha-Shanah and Yom Kipur, according to a North African rite.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi (North African) semi-cursive script, of the 16th or 17th century.

binding.p: Post-1600. Brown leather, blind tooled. Boxed. Spine: 'Ordo Precum In Novum Annum. Et In Die Expiationis. Hebraice. Mus. Brit. Jure Emptionis. 19,781.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: M. Aschkenazi: purchased from him by the British Museum through D. Nutt on 08 April 1854: inscribed, folio [211v].
